briefTitle: A Study of 2 Doses of a Hepatitis B Vaccine (V232 RECOMBIVAX HB) in Healthy Infants (V232-057)
officialTitle: A Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of 2 Antigen Doses of Recombinant Hepatitis B Vaccine Manufactured With a Modified Process Administered to Healthy Infants at 2, 4, and 6 Months of Age

arms.label: Modified Process Hepatitis B vaccine 5 μg
Modified Process Hepatitis B vaccine 10 μg

summary: This study was conducted in healthy infants and will provide new immunogenicity and safety data for the modified process hepatitis B vaccine. This study was conducted to address the following: to evaluate the immunogenicity and safety data of the 5 microgram dose of the modified process hepatitis B vaccine compared with a 10 microgram dose of the modified process hepatitis B vaccine, to evaluate another dosing schedule of 2, 4, and 6 months, and to provide descriptive immunogenicity data of another marketed vaccine (ENGERIX-B®).

primaryOutcome.measure: The Percentage of Seroresponders to the Modified Process Hepatitis B Vaccine (5 μg and 10 μg Dose), RECOMBIVAX HB™ Hepatitis B Vaccine (Currently Licensed Vaccine), and ENGERIX-B®
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 7 months of age (1 month after 3 doses)

effectByArm.arm: Modified Process Hepatitis B Vaccine 5 µg (Micrograms)
Modified Process Hepatitis B Vaccine 10 µg
